023import java.util.AbstractSet;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.Collections;
027import java.util.HashSet;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.LinkedList;
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.Queue;
032import java.util.Set;
033import java.util.stream.Collectors;
034
035import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
036import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.DelaunayTriangulation;
037import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.Triangle;
038import imagingbook.pub.geometry.delaunay.Utils;
039
040
041/**
042 * <p>
043 * Implementation of the incremental triangulation algorithm proposed by Paul Chew.
044 * This code is partly based on Paul Chew's original (applet) implementation, downloaded from 
045 * http://www.cs.cornell.edu/Info/People/chew/Delaunay.html (DelaunaySourceCodeJava60.zip)
046 * under the following license:
047 * </p>
048 * <pre>
049 * Copyright (c) 2005, 2007 by L. Paul Chew.
050 * 
051 * Permission is hereby granted, without written agreement and without
052 * license or royalty fees, to use, copy, modify, and distribute this
053 * software and its documentation for any purpose, subject to the following
054 * conditions:
055 * 
056 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included
057 * in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
058 * 
059 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS
060 * OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
061 * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
062 * AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
063 * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING
064 * FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER
065 * DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
066 * </pre>
067 * <p>
068 * <strong>Original description:</strong> 
069 * <em>The actual data structure here is a Delaunay Triangulation. The Voronoi Diagram is built on-the-fly
070 * from the Delaunay Triangulation. The Delaunay Triangulation is built within a large triangle whose vertices
071 * are well off-screen. That's why in the Delaunay Triangulation there are lines heading off-screen. 
072 * This technique makes the code simpler since otherwise additional code would be needed to handle new sites
073 * that are outside the convex hull of the previous sites.</em>
074 * <br>
075 * <em>The algorithm: To insert a new site, we walk across the triangulation, starting from the most recently created
076 * triangle, until we find the triangle that contains the new site. This triangle and any adjacent triangles that
077 * contain this new site in their circumcircle are eliminated and the resulting empty spot is re-triangulated.
078 * The site-insertion part of this technique is commonly called the Bowyer-Watson Algorithm. The expected time to
079 * insert a new site is roughly O(n1/2) where n is the current number of sites.</em>
080 * </p>
081 * 
082 * Adapted by W. Burger
083 * @version 2020-01-02
084 */
085public class TriangulationChew extends AbstractSet<Triangle2D> implements DelaunayTriangulation {
086
087    private Triangle2D mostRecent = null;      // Most recently "active" triangle
088    private final Triangle2D superTriangle;
089    private final Graph<Triangle2D> triGraph;        // Holds triangles for navigation
090    private final List<Pnt2d> points;
091    
092    /** 
093     * Convenience constructor for insertion into a bounding rectangle
094     * of the specified size (with the origin assumed at 0/0).
095     * Typical used for images.
096     * @param width the width of the insertion rectangle
097     * @param height the height of the insertion rectangle
098     */
099    public TriangulationChew(double width, double height) {
100        this(Utils.makeOuterTriangle(width, height));
101    }
102   
103    /**
104     * Constructor that takes an initial outer (super) triangle.
105     * @param outerTriangle the outer (super) triangle
106     */
107    public TriangulationChew(Pnt2d[] outerTriangle) {
108        this(new Triangle2D(outerTriangle));
109    }
110    
111    /**
112     * Constructor that accepts a set of 2D points to triangulate.
113     * The outer (super) triangle is calculated from the point coordinates.
114     * The points are inserted into the resulting triangulation.
115     * @param pointSet a sequence of 2D points
116     */
117    public TriangulationChew(Collection<Pnt2d> pointSet) {
118        this(new Triangle2D(Utils.makeOuterTriangle(pointSet)));
119        insertAll(pointSet);
120    }
121    
122    /**
123     * All sites must fall within the initial triangle.
124     * @param superTriangle the initial triangle
125     */
126    private TriangulationChew (Triangle2D superTriangle) {
127        this.superTriangle = superTriangle;
128        this.triGraph = new Graph<Triangle2D>();
129        this.triGraph.add(superTriangle);
130        this.mostRecent = superTriangle;
131        this.points = new ArrayList<>();
132    }
133    
134    // ----------------------------------------------------------
135    
136    public Triangle2D getSuperTriangle() {
137        return this.superTriangle;
138    }
139
140    /* The following two methods are required by AbstractSet */
141
142    @Override
143    public Iterator<Triangle2D> iterator () {
144        return triGraph.nodeSet().iterator();
145    }
146
147    @Override
148    public int size () {
149        return triGraph.nodeSet().size();
150    }
151
152    @Override
153    public String toString () {
154        return "Triangulation with " + size() + " triangles";
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * True iff triangle is a member of this triangulation.
159     * This method isn't required by AbstractSet, but it improves efficiency.
160     * @param triangle the object to check for membership
161     */
162    public boolean contains (Object triangle) {
163        return triGraph.nodeSet().contains(triangle);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Report neighbor opposite the given vertex of triangle.
168     * @param site a vertex of triangle
169     * @param triangle we want the neighbor of this triangle
170     * @return the neighbor opposite site in triangle; null if none
171     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if site is not in this triangle
172     */
173    public Triangle2D neighborOpposite (Pnt site, Triangle2D triangle) {
174        if (!triangle.contains(site))
175            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Bad vertex; not in triangle");
176        for (Triangle2D neighbor: triGraph.neighbors(triangle)) {
177            if (!neighbor.contains(site)) return neighbor;
178        }
179        return null;
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Return the set of triangles adjacent to triangle.
184     * @param triangle the triangle to check
185     * @return the neighbors of triangle
186     */
187    public Set<Triangle2D> neighbors(Triangle2D triangle) {
188        return triGraph.neighbors(triangle);
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Report triangles surrounding site in order (cw or ccw).
193     * @param site we want the surrounding triangles for this site
194     * @param triangle a "starting" triangle that has site as a vertex
195     * @return all triangles surrounding site in order (cw or ccw)
196     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if site is not in triangle
197     */
198    public List<Triangle2D> surroundingTriangles (Pnt site, Triangle2D triangle) {
199        if (!triangle.contains(site))
200            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site not in triangle");
201        List<Triangle2D> list = new ArrayList<Triangle2D>();
202        Triangle2D start = triangle;
203        Pnt guide = triangle.getVertexButNot(site);        // Affects cw or ccw
204        while (true) {
205            list.add(triangle);
206            Triangle2D previous = triangle;
207            triangle = this.neighborOpposite(guide, triangle); // Next triangle
208            guide = previous.getVertexButNot(site, guide);     // Update guide
209            if (triangle == start) break;
210        }
211        return list;
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Locate the triangle with point inside it or on its boundary.
216     * @param point the point to locate
217     * @return the triangle that holds point; null if no such triangle
218     */
219    public Triangle2D locate (Pnt point) {
220        Triangle2D triangle = mostRecent;
221        if (!this.contains(triangle)) {
222                triangle = null;
223        }
224        // Try a directed walk (this works fine in 2D, but can fail in 3D)
225        Set<Triangle2D> visited = new HashSet<Triangle2D>();
226        while (triangle != null) {
227            if (visited.contains(triangle)) { // This should never happen
228                System.out.println("Warning: Caught in a locate loop");
229                break;
230            }
231            visited.add(triangle);
232            // Corner opposite point
233            Pnt corner = point.isOutside(triangle.toArray(new Pnt[0]));
234            if (corner == null) return triangle;
235            triangle = this.neighborOpposite(corner, triangle);
236        }
237        // No luck; try brute force
238        System.out.println("Warning: Checking all triangles for " + point);
239        for (Triangle2D tri: this) {
240            if (point.isOutside(tri.toArray(new Pnt[0])) == null) {
241                return tri;
242            }
243        }
244        // No such triangle
245        System.out.println("Warning: No triangle holds " + point);
246        return null;
247    }
248    
249    public void insertAll(Collection<Pnt2d> pointSet) {
250        for (Pnt2d p : pointSet) {
251                insert(p);
252        }
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Place a new site into the DT.
257     * Nothing happens if the site matches an existing DT vertex.
258     * Uses straightforward scheme rather than best asymptotic time.
259     * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if p does not lie in any triangle.
260     * @param p the point to be inserted
261     */
262    public void insert(Pnt2d p) {
263        Pnt vec = new Pnt(p);
264        // Locate containing triangle
265        Triangle2D triangle = locate(vec);
266        // Give up if no containing triangle or if site is already in DT
267        if (triangle == null)
268            throw new IllegalArgumentException("No containing triangle");
269//        if (triangle.contains(vec)) 
270//              return;
271        if (!triangle.contains(vec)) {
272                // Determine the cavity and update the triangulation
273                Set<Triangle2D> cavity = getCavity(vec, triangle);
274                mostRecent = update(vec, cavity);
275        }
276        points.add(p);
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Determine the cavity caused by site.
281     * @param site the site causing the cavity
282     * @param triangle the triangle containing site
283     * @return set of all triangles that have site in their circumcircle
284     */
285    private Set<Triangle2D> getCavity (Pnt site, Triangle2D triangle) {
286        Set<Triangle2D> encroached = new HashSet<Triangle2D>();
287        Queue<Triangle2D> toBeChecked = new LinkedList<Triangle2D>();
288        Set<Triangle2D> marked = new HashSet<Triangle2D>();
289        toBeChecked.add(triangle);
290        marked.add(triangle);
291        while (!toBeChecked.isEmpty()) {
292            triangle = toBeChecked.remove();
293            if (site.vsCircumcircle(triangle.toArray(new Pnt[0])) == 1)
294                continue; // Site outside triangle => triangle not in cavity
295            encroached.add(triangle);
296            // Check the neighbors
297            for (Triangle2D neighbor: triGraph.neighbors(triangle)){
298                if (marked.contains(neighbor)) continue;
299                marked.add(neighbor);
300                toBeChecked.add(neighbor);
301            }
302        }
303        return encroached;
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Update the triangulation by removing the cavity triangles and then
308     * filling the cavity with new triangles.
309     * @param site the site that created the cavity
310     * @param cavity the triangles with site in their circumcircle
311     * @return one of the new triangles
312     */
313    private Triangle2D update (Pnt site, Set<Triangle2D> cavity) {
314        Set<Set<Pnt>> boundary = new HashSet<Set<Pnt>>();
315        Set<Triangle2D> theTriangles = new HashSet<Triangle2D>();
316
317        // Find boundary facets and adjacent triangles
318        for (Triangle2D triangle: cavity) {
319            theTriangles.addAll(neighbors(triangle));
320            for (Pnt vertex: triangle) {
321                Set<Pnt> facet = triangle.facetOpposite(vertex);
322                if (boundary.contains(facet)) boundary.remove(facet);
323                else boundary.add(facet);
324            }
325        }
326        theTriangles.removeAll(cavity);        // Adj triangles only
327
328        // Remove the cavity triangles from the triangulation
329        for (Triangle2D triangle: cavity) triGraph.remove(triangle);
330
331        // Build each new triangle and add it to the triangulation
332        Set<Triangle2D> newTriangles = new HashSet<Triangle2D>();
333        for (Set<Pnt> vertices: boundary) {
334            vertices.add(site);
335            Triangle2D tri = new Triangle2D(vertices);
336            triGraph.add(tri);
337            newTriangles.add(tri);
338        }
339
340        // Update the graph links for each new triangle
341        theTriangles.addAll(newTriangles);    // Adj triangle + new triangles
342        for (Triangle2D triangle: newTriangles)
343            for (Triangle2D other: theTriangles)
344                if (triangle.isNeighbor(other))
345                    triGraph.add(triangle, other);
346
347        // Return one of the new triangles
348        return newTriangles.iterator().next();
349    }
350    
351    /**
352     * Checks if the given triangle shares a vertex with the triangulation's
353     * initial ('super') triangle.
354     * @param otherTriangle the other triangle
355     * @return {@code true} iff there is a common vertex
356     */
357    private boolean connectsToSuperTriangle(Triangle2D otherTriangle) {
358        boolean connects = false;
359        for (Pnt vertex : superTriangle) {
360            if (otherTriangle.contains(vertex)) {
361                connects = true;
362                break;
363            }
364        }
365        return connects;
366    }
367    
368        @Override
369        public List<Triangle> getTriangles() {
370                return this.stream().filter(t -> !connectsToSuperTriangle(t)).collect(Collectors.toList());
371        }
372        
373        @Override
374        public List<Pnt2d> getPoints() {
375                return Collections.unmodifiableList(points);
376        }
377
